title: Trader Says Ethereum Rival That’s Exploded Over 300% To ‘Keep Running,’ Unveils Targets for Chainlink and Sushi - The Daily Hodl
content:
A widely followed crypto analyst says that one Ethereum (ETH) rival that’s skyrocketed by over 300% this year still has more room to rally.

Pseudonymous crypto trader Altcoin Sherpa tells his 194,200 followers on the social media platform X that smart contract platform Solana (SOL) will likely continue surging up in price until proven otherwise.

The strategist also says he’s not sure what will become of bankrupt crypto exchange FTX’s holdings of Solana worth $1.16 billion as of August 31st.

“SOL: I think that $35-$32 are buy-the-dip zones. I don’t know what happens with FTX supply but this should keep running until shown otherwise.”

Solana is trading for $39.83 at time of writing, a staggering 300% rise since the start of 2023 when it was moving for just $9.97.

Moving on to the decentralized crypto exchange (DEX) platform SushiSwap (SUSHI), Altcoin Sherpa says that accumulating the digital asset at $0.91 seems like a good idea with the 0.5 Fibonacci level offering support.

“SUSHI: I think buying $0.91 seems pretty solid. S/R(support and resistance) level, etc.”

At time of writing, SUSHI is worth $1.06.

The crypto strategist concludes his analysis by noting that traders should keep an eye on the $9.50 price level of the decentralized oracle provider Chainlink (LINK).

“LINK: come on… let’s fill the rest of my bids, please. $9.50 is the area.”

At time of writing, LINK is trading for $11.32.

title: Trader Lays Out Bearish Scenario for Solana if History Repeats, Updates Outlook on Bitcoin and Dogecoin - The Daily Hodl
content:
A widely followed crypto analyst is warning that Ethereum (ETH) competitor Solana (SOL) could undergo a sudden market correction.

Pseudonymous crypto analyst Rekt Capital tells his 363,800 followers on the social media platform X that if SOL fails to flip a key level into support, it could follow a prior price pattern to the downside.

“SOL: if history repeats, Solana may experience some extreme volatility both to the upside beyond $42.86 (red) and if the rejection is strong, even downside volatility to as low as $30 (below purple box). Will history repeat? If it does, I’d be ready.”

The trader warns that the longer SOL trades below the $42 range, the greater the probability of a deep correction.

“Solana already producing some upside wicks beyond ~$42.86. Continue to stay below this resistance and SOL could see a deeper pullback over time.”

Looking at the trader’s chart, he seems to refer to SOL’s price action in early 2021 when Solana witnessed a deep pullback after failing to take out its resistance at around $42

Solana is trading for $39.56 at time of writing.

Next up, the trader says that Bitcoin (BTC) will likely continue to rally toward its diagonal resistance at around $42,000 before the halving. According to the trader, he expects BTC to retrace after hitting the diagonal resistance before turning it into support after the halving.

The halving, which is scheduled to take place in April 2024, is traditionally viewed as a bullish event as it slashes miners’ rewards in half.

Says Rekt Capital,

“Bitcoin may reject from the black trendline resistance prior to the halving (orange circle). But it will likely retest it as support after the halving (black circle).”

Bitcoin is trading for $34,620 at time of writing.

Lastly, the trader weighs in on Dogecoin (DOGE). He says he is closely watching whether the memecoin can convincingly break out of a descending channel on the weekly chart.

“Really important [whether] this week’s ‘buy-the-dip’ behavior is enough to get DOGE above the channel top. Because previous weekly closes below the channel top followed by brief rebounds still preceded downside (orange)…

That ‘buy-the-dip’ behavior we saw yesterday is looking like relief under key resistance. However, there has been no strong DOGE rejection and downside continuation. The most important signal is a weekly close above the channel top to confirm a breakout.”

Looking at the trader’s chart, he appears to be looking at DOGE to breach the top of the channel’s resistance at around $0.07.

DOGE is trading for $0.0681 at time of writing.

title: Bitcoin, Solana, Partnerships and Crypto Jokes - Cryptonews
content:
Blasting Bitcoin, Jumping Solana, Partnerships Galore and 20 Crypto Jokes

This week in crypto: bitcoin blasted back above $35,000 as bulls regained control, the solana price rallied more than 50% in a week, and the Celestia project surpassed a $370m market cap following a highly anticipated launch. MicroStrategy acquired an additional 155 BTC at the cost of $5.3 million, and think-tank Mox Capital committed $410 million to “further explore digital assets”. Also, Bitcoin halving in 2024 is approaching – here’s everything you need to know.

Then, Deutsche Telekom became a validator of privacy-focused Aleph Zero, Visa successfully concluded the CBDC pilot program in Hong Kong with HSBC and Hang Seng Bank, St.Galler Kantonalbank partnered with SEBA Bank to offer custody and trading services for bitcoin and ethereum, Hashkey Group said it would issue a stablecoin in partnership with Yuanbi Technology and Zhongan Bank, and Thailand’s second-largest bank Kasikorn Bank acquired a 97% stake in the parent company of Satang crypto exchange.

As that was happening, three games backed by Disney, Alibaba, Google, and Square Enix committed to building on Immutable zkEVM, Bugatti and Adidas partnered to auction a limited-edition football shoe that will come with a digital twin, MetaMask and Blockaid partnered to introduce a new feature aimed at bolstering user security, and another team member said goodbye to Stars Arena, and the Coinbase-backed advocacy group Stand With Crypto raised $2 million in a couple of months.

In the exchange realm, Coinbase rolled out bitcoin and ethereum futures for US investors, Binance planned to end its partnership with Advcash and end the ruble-based transactions, Bitfinex landed on the UK financial watchdog’s warning list for unauthorized promotion of financial services, a court judge approved Bittrex Chapter 11 plan to cease its operations, and Busan started seeking operators for the upcoming Busan Digital Asset Exchange.

In the trial of a crypto century (which is, like, 2 regular years), the Assistant US Attorney claimed the FTX founder built a crypto exchange based on fraud, SBF admitted that Alameda had “special privileges” on FTX, he concluded testimony with the defense resting the case, and the prosecution and the defense faced-off during the closing arguments. Meanwhile, Terraform Labs and Do Kwon filed a motion to dismiss allegations of multi-billion-dollar securities fraud, and Daniel Shin denied involvement in the collapse of Terra pointing the finger at Do Kwon.

Then, the UK government unveiled a comprehensive cryptoasset regulatory framework, the UK’s National Crime Agency sought to set up a specialized team to combat cryptocurrency scams and fraud, South Korea’s new crypto crime investigation unit was already ‘overloaded’, Russian politicians wanted to ban private citizens from mining crypto, and a VanEck strategy advisor argued that El Salvador was poised to become a financial center of the Americas.

While PayPal received the UK FCA approval to offer crypto services to UK nationals, the US SEC issued a subpoena to PayPal over its newly launched stablecoin PYUSD. The SEC also charged SafeMoon executives for ‘massive fraudulent scheme’ and unregistered offering of crypto securities.

Meanwhile, Russia’s intelligence service FSB charged a man with ‘high treason’ for ‘donating crypto to Ukraine’, a court in China handed down sentences to 21 individuals in a $300 million USDT money laundering case, Taiwan’s police busted a major crypto money laundering operation involving $320 million worth of USDT, and Indian police arrested one of the main accused as part of the investigation into the alleged $240 million crypto scam.

Let’s laugh.

__________

GM, all. We were all bulls this Halloween.

__

Meanwhile, hodlers acknowledge the development with a nod.

bitcoin goes from 34,000 to 33,000 investors: pic.twitter.com/Y9YlKK7RXa — Teddy (@TeddyCleps) October 27, 2023

__

Spend a lot to earn more…of nothing.

this is what trading meme coins looks likepic.twitter.com/MpdgZ0HH8Q — LilMoonLambo (@LilMoonLambo) November 2, 2023

__

It’s never too late. This, too, will once be early.

__

So back!

__

There is one step, really. Not complicated.

__

And you, and you, and you, not you, and you, and you….

__

That’s a negative.

__

Some things you don’t ask.

"Dad what was it like farming food coins during DEFI Summer?" pic.twitter.com/L65FKIV4g8 — moon (@MoonOverlord) October 31, 2023

__

Just one more.

“Dad what was trading on Bitmex like?” pic.twitter.com/lHz1JRQ5ja — Mayne (@Tradermayne) October 26, 2023

__

He gave his best. But his best is never enough.

Gensler watching crypto pump even despite repeatedly delaying the ETF and calling crypto a scam at every opportunity pic.twitter.com/FKJXItFZWM — Cred (@CryptoCred) October 26, 2023

__

Such a happy politician.

__

Had it coming.

what we where really doing depositing funds in FTX…pic.twitter.com/usHNfoXHte — xamanap (@xamanap) October 27, 2023

__

‘I mean, what’s even dinner. So relative.’

Sam might get off with the "It was supper not dinner" defense. pic.twitter.com/aO9ZLBcxXU — Autism Capital 🧩 (@AutismCapital) October 31, 2023

__

Sure is.

__

What happens when you combine two major news of the week?

__

Take one all.

this is how the FTX team celebrated halloween as kids pic.twitter.com/WeeOHxzvSP — LilMoonLambo (@LilMoonLambo) November 1, 2023

__

Clearly wasn’t easy getting in.

__

Well, he’s keeping up.

How it feels to be a 35~ year old crypto trader trying to keep up with the kids pic.twitter.com/jY0Iopgi00 — Charlie (@btc_charlie) November 2, 2023

__

A true documentary based on real characters with actual footage.

title: Solana Emerges as a Standout Altcoin: Is This the Next Big Thing in Crypto? - The Currency Analytics
content:
In the fast-paced world of cryptocurrencies, Solana has recently taken center stage with a remarkable 27% surge in the past week. This digital asset, often referred to as an “altcoin,” is making waves in the market, but it’s not without its ups and downs. In the last 24 hours, Solana experienced an 8% dip, leaving many investors and analysts pondering its true potential.

Cryptocurrency markets have always been a rollercoaster, with prices surging and plummeting at seemingly random intervals. This volatile nature makes it challenging for both seasoned investors and newcomers to predict the future of any particular cryptocurrency accurately. Solana, however, seems to have distinguished itself by making headlines for its recent impressive rally.

Is Solana’s recent surge a mere rebound, or does it signify a bright future for this altcoin? Let’s delve deeper into the factors that are propelling Solana’s newfound prominence and what potential lies ahead for this digital asset.

Solana’s Meteoric Rise

Solana, often referred to as a rising star among altcoins, has experienced a remarkable 27% surge in its value over the past week. This surge has garnered significant attention in the cryptocurrency community, drawing in both new and experienced investors.

What sets Solana apart from other cryptocurrencies is its unique approach to blockchain technology. Solana aims to address some of the inherent limitations of blockchain networks, such as slow transaction speeds and high fees. It achieves this by utilizing a unique consensus mechanism known as “proof-of-history” in conjunction with the more traditional “proof-of-stake” model.

The proof-of-history mechanism, a novel addition to Solana’s architecture, timestamps transactions and events within the network, creating an immutable historical record. This innovation significantly enhances the network’s efficiency, allowing for faster transaction processing and increased scalability. Solana’s emphasis on speed and efficiency has made it an attractive option for developers and users alike.

Solana’s Ups and Downs

Despite its recent success, Solana hasn’t been immune to the inherent volatility of the cryptocurrency market. In the last 24 hours alone, it experienced an 8% dip in its value, leaving investors and analysts uncertain about its near-term prospects.

This sudden dip raises questions about Solana’s ability to maintain its upward momentum. Many investors are wary of a potential bubble, while others see this dip as a healthy correction after a period of rapid growth.

Is Solana Undervalued?

Some experts argue that Solana’s recent impressive rally is simply a rebound after being undervalued for an extended period. They point out that the project’s unique features and innovative technology may have been overlooked until recently, leading to a price surge as more investors discover its potential.

Solana’s blockchain technology is not only fast but also cost-effective, addressing some of the fundamental issues that have plagued other blockchains like Bitcoin and Ethereum. Its potential applications extend to various industries, including decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFTs), and gaming.

The Ethereum network, for example, has faced congestion and high gas fees, making it less suitable for some applications. Solana’s emergence as a viable alternative with fast transaction speeds and lower fees has attracted developers and users looking for a more efficient platform. This has contributed to its recent surge in popularity.

The Role of the Ecosystem

A key driver behind Solana’s rise is its vibrant and growing ecosystem. An ecosystem comprises the network’s infrastructure, applications, and users. Solana’s ecosystem has been rapidly expanding, with various decentralized applications (dApps) and projects being built on the platform.

Decentralized finance, or DeFi, has been one of the most significant drivers of growth for Solana. DeFi projects aim to create financial services without traditional intermediaries, and many of them have found Solana’s architecture to be a favorable environment for their operations. Solana’s infrastructure can handle a high volume of transactions, making it well-suited for DeFi applications, such as decentralized exchanges (DEXs), lending platforms, and yield farming.

NFTs, another hot trend in the crypto space, have also found a home on Solana. NFT platforms built on Solana offer faster and cheaper transactions, making it an attractive choice for artists, collectors, and creators in the digital art and collectibles space.

Challenges and Concerns

While Solana’s recent success is undeniable, it faces its fair share of challenges and concerns. The cryptocurrency market is highly speculative, and even promising projects can experience sudden price fluctuations. Solana’s competitors, such as Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, and Polkadot, also pose a threat. These platforms are constantly evolving and improving to address scalability and efficiency issues, making the competition in the blockchain space fierce.

Security is another critical aspect of blockchain technology, and Solana is not exempt from potential vulnerabilities. Smart contract exploits and network attacks have plagued various blockchains, and Solana must remain vigilant in ensuring the security of its ecosystem.

Moreover, regulatory scrutiny remains a concern for the cryptocurrency industry as a whole. As governments around the world grapple with how to regulate digital assets, there is uncertainty about how these regulations may impact the use and adoption of cryptocurrencies like Solana.

The Road Ahead for Solana

The future of Solana remains uncertain, as is the case with any cryptocurrency. It’s essential for investors to exercise caution and conduct thorough research before investing in any digital asset. Solana’s recent success and unique features make it an interesting contender in the cryptocurrency space, but it is not without risks.

One possible scenario for Solana’s future is continued growth and adoption. If the network can maintain its speed, scalability, and security while attracting more developers and users, it may solidify its position as a prominent blockchain platform.

On the other hand, a significant price correction or a market downturn could lead to a temporary setback for Solana. This is a possibility investors should be prepared for, given the cryptocurrency market’s history of volatility.

The regulatory landscape is also an area to watch. As governments and regulatory bodies establish guidelines for cryptocurrencies, Solana, like other blockchain platforms, may need to adapt to new compliance requirements.

In conclusion, Solana’s recent surge in value is a testament to the innovative technology and vibrant ecosystem it offers. However, it’s crucial to approach the cryptocurrency market with a measured perspective, understanding that price fluctuations are part of the game. As Solana’s story unfolds, it will be interesting to see whether it can sustain its momentum and carve out a significant place in the world of blockchain and digital assets.
